column1: Great news for Wilmington.  As an Eagle Scout being outdoors taught me so much and we need to make sure the opportunity to get outside is available to as many people as possible. https://t.co/VZIidnGqpq

This morning I got a call telling me that former State Senator Cooper Snyder passed away last night.   Cooper was my first boss. He was a teacher a mentor and like a surrogate father to me.  He taught me many… https://t.co/bTT3jP1Qiy

Does everyone remember how Americans responded on Sept 122001?   We came together.  We supported each other we comforted each other we prayed for each other.  We truly came together to be “One Nation.”  I yearn… https://t.co/vO3MPDjSm9

Today we remember the bravery of more than 160000 troops who landed on the beaches of Normandy in 1944. The sacrifices they made for our country and for our world can never be forgotten. https://t.co/b5vL9ZMj59

This is what our brave D Day heroes saw in order.  1. Stuck inside a tiny Higgins Boat. 2. Swimming & wading to a beach through heavy fire. 3. Struggling to form a beachhead with heavy artillery and machine gun fire… https://t.co/aCsgUROLe6

June is recognized as National PTS Awareness Month. Through my career with @OHNationalGuard I’ve had the opportunity to serve alongside courageous men and women and I’m committed to ensuring they have access to the treatment they need to heal – both physically and mentally.
